definition: gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)

sentences.english: As a result, he had become the soul of caution.
sentences.chinese: 結果，他就變得膽小如鼠。

sentences.english: His cowardice in face of the enemy was contemptible 7.
sentences.chinese: 他在敵人面前膽小如鼠，真是可鄙。

sentences.english: The boy is as timid as a rabbit.
After all, Europe is rich but wimpy.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟，歐洲雖富有但卻膽小如鼠。

sentences.english: He remained a mouse in public affairs.
sentences.chinese: 在公衆事務上他依然膽小如鼠。

sentences.english: Care must be taken in using this method lest overflow should occur.
sentences.chinese: 在使用此法時要膽小如鼠，以免會發生溢流現象。

sentences.english: It's gone. You're building a rat ship here, a vessel for seagoing snitches.
sentences.chinese: 現在博德培養的是一羣膽小如鼠，賣友求榮的傢伙。

sentences.english: She despised him for his cowardice.
sentences.chinese: 她因他膽小如鼠而鄙視他。

sentences.english: You could say that the cowardly lion was "chicken-hearted."
sentences.chinese: 你可以說這頭獅子“膽小如鼠。”

definition: two-faced, three knives (idiom); double-cross/double dealing and back stabbing
Please do as you wish!/You are welcome to do whatever you like!/Please make yourself at home.
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
scholars tend to disparage one another (idiom)
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
